newsitem.title: INDIA: ITC 4-mth sales growth running 22 pct ahead.
newsitem.headline: ITC 4-mth sales growth running 22 pct ahead.

text.p: India's tobacco giant ITC Ltd has recorded a 22 percent hike in its tobacco sales volume in four months to July 1996, its chairman Yogi Deveshwar said on Thursday.
ITC Ltd is 31.8 percent controlled by B.A.T Industries Plc.
Deveshwar, facing shareholders for the first time as the company's chairman at the annual shareholders' meeting, faced questions on recent media reports of mismanagment within the company.
The chairman said the company was doing well and shareholders had nothing to worry about its net profits which came in at 2.61 billion rupees in 1995/96 from 2.62 billion in the previous year.
Authorities have been questioning a few ITC executives as part of probe into alleged violation of foreign exchange norms in international trade deals.
"To the best of our knowledge there has been no FERA violation, it all depends on interpretation of laws," Deveshwar said.
Deveshwar also denied recent reports that B.A.T had already hiked its stake in the firm from its current 31.8 percent.
"I have no knowledge of such things. As far as I know B.A.T has not increased its stake," Deveshwar said.
B.A.T recently said it was interested in increasing its presence in India but announced no immediate intentions to hike its stake in ITC Ltd.
